intro: Neckia lancifolia f. major, commonly known as the broad-leaved neckia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or lowland habitats, often in sandy or limestone soils. Its foliage is evergreen, and it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance. The species is also noted for its potential ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
